alert.note: Alert for Northern Arctic Coast; Northwest Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 26 at 6:20AM AKST until January 26 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 55 below zero. * WHERE...Northwest Arctic Coast and Northern Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 3 PM AKST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. Drifting snow will continue tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...West winds 20 mph and will decrease through the day to 10 mph by this afternoon. As the winds decrease the temperatures will also fall, keeping wind chills very cold through this afternoon.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Northwest Arctic Coast
